dt: {bc}to interfere so as to weaken or change for the worse

dt.t: did not want to {wi}tamper{/wi} with tradition

dt: {bc}to render something harmful or dangerous by altering its structure or composition

dt.t: was charged with {wi}tampering{/wi} with consumer products

dt: {bc}to carry on underhand or improper negotiations (as by bribery)

{bc}to inflict physical harm, threats, intimidation, or corrupt persuasion with the goal of influencing or preventing a witness's testimony {bc}to engage in {d_link|witness tampering|witness tampering}

dt.t: These alleged efforts were the basis for Mueller's accusation that Manafort was {wi}tampering{/wi} with a witness, attempting to coach testimony, which would have violated the terms of his bail.

et: probably from Middle French {it}temprer{/it} to temper, mix, meddle {ma}{mat|temper:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: to interfere so as to weaken or change for the worse —used with with
to try foolish or dangerous experiments —used with with
to render something harmful or dangerous by altering its structure or composition

dt: {bc}to change or touch (something) especially in a way that causes damage or harm

shortdef: to change or touch (something) especially in a way that causes damage or harm
